column4: I need to install my ATI X1600 drivers...my screen res isn't correct and the right options aren't available
I need to install my ATI X1600 drivers...my screen res isn't correct and the right options aren't available
yeah, everything crashed and I had to reinstall...I didn't know how to get it back to the way it was
do I type that in a terminal?
yes, it doesn't matter what terminal, even if you can't log in with gdm you can still run that from a tty.
what video card do you have?
if there's an ati driver or radeon drivers, use them. if not, use vesa.
I downloaded drivers from ATI's site but when I tried to run it I get an error saying I "could not open the file" because gedit couldn't detect the character coding
you don't open it with gedit... just do sudo apt-get install xserver-plugin-ati
got an error "couldn't find package xserver-plugin-ati"
that link instructs me to use the restricted drivers that I've already tried. If it locks up is there a way to restore everything to the way it was?
it will get you up and running again, then you can worry about 3d accelleration.
would vga, via, vmware be any better?
don't change the default plugins, skip through it all until you get to the screen resolutions
